page.title: 03BEEF FARMING
page.content:
Most of the land around Uplawmoor is upland hill country used for the grazing of cattle or sheep.Very little of the land is used for cultivation and that which is is devoted to hay,turnips and potatoes.The hay and turnips are used for cattle-food and the potatoes as cash crops.
The cattle are pratically all beef cattle and are a mixture of Aberdeen-Angus and Hereford. The farm at Lynnhead has all blue-grey cows and is the only farm to have a large flock of ewes and lambs. Most of the cattle are served by one Charolais bull per farm.East Uplaw Farm sells its new-born calves at the market but Lynnhead keeps the calves for fattening for one year.
